data.scheme_name: Mukhyamantri Modified Interest Rebate Scheme (MMIRS) - Interest Subsidy - Male, Others - NYI
data.benefits: The scheme provides interest rebates of up to 9% annually for industrial and MSME units, promoting entrepreneurship, local employment in Goa.
data.eligibility:
All new industrial/MSME units are eligible under this scheme. 

It is applicable on loan disbursed by Economic Development Corporation (EDC).
data.conditions:
1. The unit should have their loan account classified under standard category at the end of the financial year. 
  2. Promoters who are resident of Goa for not less than last 15 years are eligible. 
  3. The unit will be entitled for interest rebate as indicated in the scheme, on the interest charged on the term loan, based on the credit rating of the borrower or as mentioned in the loan scheme.
data.beneficiaries:
1. New industrial and MSME units with loans disbursed by the EDC are eligible. Category A: Units in backward talukas of Pernem, Sattari, Sanguem, Quepem, Canacona, Bicholim, and Dharbandora. 
  2. Category B: Units promoted by Resident/Non-Resident Goan Entrepreneurs, including Native Goans, those who have lived in Goa for at least 15 years, Persons of Goan Origin (PGOs), and Non-Resident Goans (NRGs). 
  3. Category D: Units employing 20 or more Goan employees.
data.prerequisites:
1. Resident/Non-Resident Goan Entrepreneurs must hold at least 74% of the total paid-up capital. 
  2. A regular Goan employee must have been on the payroll for the entire claim year and possess 15 years of residence proof. 
  3. The loan account must be classified under the standard category at the end of the financial year. Promoters must have been residents of Goa for at least 15 years. 
  4. The unit will receive interest rebates based on the loan's interest rate, dependent on the borrower's credit rating or loan scheme terms.
data.context: Mukhyamantri Modified Interest Rebate Scheme (MMIRS) introduced to foster economic development, empower entrepreneurs, and position Goa as an attractive destination for investment.
data.objective:
1. The scheme aims to encourage investment in various sectors and promote industrial development in Goa. 
  2. By providing interest rebates on loans, the government hopes to make it easier for businesses to grow, create employment opportunities, and boost the local economy.
data.description:
• Quantum of Interest rebate Categories A - 5% p.a. 
  • Categories B - 2% p.a. 
  • Categories D - 2% p.a. 
  • Maximum interest rebate of Rs.25.00 lakhs p.a per unit.
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefit after the approval of the application by the concerned authority.
data.faq: Interest Rebate for Women | Women Entrepreneurs Scheme | EDC GOA (edc-goa.com)
data.additional_info:
1. Negative List (List of Sectors/Activity not Eligible for Interest Rebate) Alcohol & Liquor of all types. Barge Sector Construction of Commercial & Residential Complexes. Transport Sector Sponge Iron, Steel Ingots/ Rolling mills. Tobacco products. Mining Equipment & Machinery. 
  2. All Rescheduled/restructured loans. Loans extended to Government Corporations, CMRY & GTEGP loans, Personal loans, Housing Loans and Vehicle loans any other sector/activity as decided by the Government from time to time. 
  3. New loans including takeover loans (Standard category), are eligible, provided the activity/sector is not included in the negative list. Working Capital Term loans would also be eligible under the scheme. 
  4. The rebate eligible will be adjusted towards the principal/interest outstanding/payable by the borrower to EDC, in the subsequent financial year, subject to receipt of the same from the Government or if regular the same reimbursed to the unit. 
  5. The present interest rebate scheme shall not be applicable, if the unit/party is already availing interest subsidy/rebate benefit, under any Central or State Government Schemes. 
  6. In case the unit is found ineligible on account of misrepresentation/miscalculation, the amount of interest rebate released shall be repayable forthwith by the unit/party and shall become recoverable as arrears of Land Revenue.
data.checklist_info_a:
Copy of valid Udyam Registration or Certificate from Factories and Boilers in case of industrial units and from other authorities, as applicable.
Residence certificate for last 15 years from Mamlatdar.
NRGs- Birth Certificate or School leaving Certificate, Passport & Address proof for place of residence.
Shareholding pattern as of 31st March, every year, duly certified by Chartered Accountant, in case of partnership/limited companies.
Employment details of Goan Employees during the Financial Year duly certified by Chartered Accountant.
data.beneficiary: Specific Industries - Proprietorship, Partnership, Limited liability Partnership (LLP), Private Limited Company, Public Company - Goa - All MSMEs and All Non-MSMEs
data.lifecycle: Required Credit Support for Scale - Up
